```{r}

library(tidyverse)
```

## Subsetting data sets

We subset rows in a data set using the `filter` command, which loads with tidyverse. Let's see this using `penguins`.

```{r}
glimpse(penguins)

```
A set with just adelies:

```{r}
filter(penguins,
       species == "Adelie")
```

```{r}
penguins_sm <- filter(penguins, 
                      body_mass > 3600)
glimpse(penguins_sm)
```

Two conditions at once:
```{r}
penguins_sm <- filter(penguins, 
                      body_mass > 3600,
                      species == "Adelie")
glimpse(penguins_sm)
```

One species or another:
```{r}
penguins_sm <- filter(penguins, 
                      species == "Adelie" | 
                        species == "Chinstrap")
glimpse(penguins_sm)
```
